description.content: Represents the numeric status code returned by the server in response to an HTTP request.

documentation.content: Indicates the outcome of an HTTP request. Common codes include 200 (OK), 201 (Created), 400 (Bad Request), 401 (Unauthorized), 404 (Not Found), and 500 (Internal Server Error).

description.content: A collection of key-value pairs containing additional request metadata.

documentation.content: Optional headers that can define content type, authorization, cookies, caching policies, and more.

description.content: The data to include in the body of the request, typically used with methods like POST or PUT.

documentation.content: Contains the request payload, such as JSON, XML, form data, or binary content, depending on the Content-Type header.

description.content: Builds an HTTP response object using the specified status code, headers, and optional response body.

documentation.content: Creates a complete HTTP response object to be returned from a server. The response includes a status code, headers, and an optional body containing the response content.
